headline: King Ranch Chicken Casserole
description: This classic King Ranch chicken casserole, bursting with chicken, corn tortillas, tomatoes, peppers, and cheese makes a supreme supper or potluck dish.
name: King Ranch Chicken Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL®)
1 (3 pound) cooked chicken, torn into shreds or cut into chunks
10 (6 inch) corn tortillas, cut into quarters

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat. Saute onion and bell peppers in the hot oil until warmed through, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl.
Add both cans of condensed soup, diced tomatoes with chile peppers, chicken broth, sour cream, cumin, ancho chile powder, oregano, and chipotle chile powder; mix until sauce is well-combined.
Spread a few tablespoons of sauce in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish. Layer with 1/2 of the chicken, 1/2 of the sauce, 1/2 of the Cheddar cheese, and 1/2 of the tortillas.

Spread the remaining chicken over the tortillas. Spread all but 1/2 cup of the remaining sauce over the chicken, then top with another 1/3 of the Cheddar, and the remaining tortillas. Spread the remaining 1/2 cup over top, and sprinkle with the remaining Cheddar.
Bake casserole in the preheated oven until bubbling, about 40 minutes.
Turn on the broiler and broil until the top is golden, 2 to 3 more minutes.

review.reviewBody: Good flavor but way too heavy on the onion. Next time I'd increase the amount of chicken and reduce the onion.
Definitely will make this again! Unfortunately I did not have corn tortillas on hand ,so I used flour. Flour tortillas a little soggy. Use corn,as stated in recipe.

I bought corn tortillas and cut them into 4 triangles. Then I fried them in oil. It was terrific. No green peppers for me though. I love cheese and decided to use cheddar and Jack, and more than the recipe called for. Next time I will add refried beans from the Mexican restaurant near me.

Made this as directed for the first time, it’s good but just not the kind of thing we really enjoy. The sauce was quite tasty but the texture of the tortillas was odd. Not bad but just unexpected. The tortillas soak up the sauce and become very soft and almost indistinguishable from pasta. Overall the flavours are good here but it’s not something we’d make more than once in a while.

This is my new go to casserole for family & friend or a work potluck. I tweaked the recipe slighly No green bell peppers - sub'ed in poblano peppers, and sub'ed in tortilla chips rather than the raw tortillas. everyone raves over this chicken dish. It's tasty and filling, but don't be shy with the tortilla chips - some of my work crew members ate this like it was chicken dip. Its a fantastic recipe.
Turned out very well, used a little more cheese than the 8oz.

Loved it. I didn't have all the ingredients but I saw so many comments about alternate versions that I decided to substitute a custard cream for the chicken and tortillas, sugar for the soup sauce, raspberries for the Ro-tel, left out the vegetables and spices, and froze rather than cooked it. It was almost like a delightful Ice Cream...

This is the closest to actual King Ranch chicken recipe that I've seen in a long time. I learned to make it in the 70's in south Texas from a native of the area. I don't know why she cuts the tortillas into quarters, just lay them in there whole. I won't go into all the finer points but sometimes celery is added, just not beans or corn. Beans are served on the side and just put them on there if you like when you eat it. If you just must, then ok, it's for you. Cheddar cheese, yes. For extra kick, that's what hot sauce is for. Each person makes their food as hot as they want, or leave it like it is. Rotel alone has a bit of heat it in for lightweights. If you want the actual thing, follow this recipe and you'll have it.
This casserole is the bomb! I'm not a big fan of peppers but this changed my mind. I added corn and black beans to the mixture. So good!
My family and I loved it!

I made this recently and it was delicious and easy, I used hard taco shells in place of fresh tortillas, I also added a can of refried beans to the sauce, shared it with my neighbors, they too loved it, will make it again, I may add a bit of chorizo to the chicken next time, great taste

I loved this recipe. I was looking for something new to do with left over chicken and this was great. I added corn to the vegies and since I didn't have the chipotle chile powder I added a few drop of liquid smoke. Otherwise it was pretty close and I really like it. plus it was a hit with the gang.
This is so good it will become part of your rotation for dinner
This is a great cross between a chicken pot pie and a soft taco. Everybody loved it.
I tweaked the recipe a little by using golden mushroom soup and taco blend cheese and just a dash of cayenne!
Only 1 chilli powder Use rotisserie chicken Used cr of chicken and celery soups

This was so good. I seasoned my chicken to my liking and since I didn't have the chipotle or ancho chili powder, I just used regular chili powder and it was delicious. Will definitely be making again.
I made this and it was 💧 I followed the recipe to a tee with the exception of a few spices that I didn't have. It was like soup.

I make King Ranch Casserole a lot, but I'm always playing with the recipe--so here are my thoughts on this one. The sour cream is a great touch, and I'm keeping it. Skip the chicken broth, or at least reduce it to ¼ cup. This is the only recipe I've seen that uses it, and I took to heart all the complaints about the sauce being too soupy. But the taste is great! So my advice is to make it, just leave out the broth.

I lightly fried my corn tortillas in a couple tablespoons of oil (actually I prefer pork lard) until they were slightly firm but not crisp. It give a flavor boost to the casserole. tasted just like chicken enchiladas. Loved it!

Really good. Just as I remembered as a child. Now my child loves it also. I normally don't like using canned soups, however, I was able to find ones at Kroger that were good ingredients, so it was still an easy prep meal.

This was good and fed a lot of people. However, the suggestions to add a poblano pepper with the onion and bell pepper are good as well. (Needs more heat/spice) Because I didn’t have a poblano in the fridge, I used a can of mild diced green chilies instead. Came out very good. A Tex-mex casserole perfect for large families or a potluck.

My mom always makes king ranch and even though she never uses the same ingredients, it always tastes great. I knew something was a bit off with this recipe when my sauce mixture looked like throw up but i kept going. Then when it came time to layer there wasn’t really any binding agents on the first 3-4 layers so I was confused how it was supposed to hold together. I used quite a bit of cheese but it only held on the top half where the majority of tortillas were. It tastes okay, I would have added more cheese and tortillas personally but the sloppiness is the reason behind my rating. I never rate stuff but the recipe ruined my day tbh.
Made the recipe as written. This is my new go to for King Ranch Chicken.
Very tasty but too liquidy. I would cut broth to 1/2 cup and increase tortillas to 12.
No changes. This recipe was good just as is!!! Loved it
2-22-22 Loved the flavor of this casserole, for some reason mine came out pretty sloppy. Resembled more of a soup. Still delicious.

I am not a fan of tomatoes with chiles, so I used a can of plain diced tomatoes instead. I didn't want it too spicy, so I used 1 1/2 tsp. regular chili powder instead of the ancho & chipotle chili powders. I left off the sour cream & it wasn't missed. I layered whole tortillas instead of cutting them into quarters & would do that again. Delicious flavor in this casserole - thanks for the recipe!

I was looking for something to do with my remaining rotisserie chicken. I remembered this as I used to make a similar version when my kids where little. I made it close, used poblano pepper instead of bells. Added peas because that is how we always had it before. Did not add the broth, as that makes it soupy. Then after baking covered for 30 minutes, I added more cheese and nacho Doritos as my family doesn't like soggy tortillas. Uncover and cook for 5 more minutes, great. If you have left overs, it is fun to roll them tight in tortilla and fry them, then serve with cheese or salsa dips.

My family does not like bell peppers so i used fresh Anaheim pepper shredded in the food processor with deveined and seeded jalapeños and serrano. sauté with onions/garlic. The different chili powders makes it wonderfully yummy! I do quarter up fresh corn tortillas, family loved them. The problem i have is it “disappears”
thanks for the wonderful recipe!
Awesome comfort food. The whole family loved it!

I made this recipe as instructed and even used the idea of using pepper jack cheese from the reviews. I feel like more detailed instructions could be beneficial like do I drain the Rotel? I say this because when the casserole was done and I started serving it, it had a lot of excess liquid in the pan . All the photos looked the same as my finished product until we started to scoop out of the dish.. Anyone else have this issue? Other than that it's a good dish.

I've seen King Ranch Recipes over the decades and have never tried one until today. I followed this one almost exactly except I added 8 oz. of fresh mushrooms and zucchini because I wanted to add more veggies to the casserole. Am glad I did because there was so much sauce that I had some leftover. The flavor was great but I thought it was way too saucy even with the added veggies (even though I didn't add all of the sauce). Hubby liked it and said he would eat it again and so would I with a few modifications. I would also add about 3-4 ounces sliced black olives and bake it for 55-65 minutes instead of 40 as the recipe states. It wasn't quite hot enough in the middle after 40 minutes. Otherwise, a simple meal that warms the insides on a cold day. Good flavors, too!

This was very good. I couldn’t find ancho chili powder anywhere. But it was very good. Next time I will use more chicken. It came out of the oven super bubbly. I let it stand for about 8 minutes before I rang the dinner bell. It set up quite nicely. This would be great for a potluck like event.
I like this recipe, but I will add cream cheese next time for a thicker sauce.
I like this recipe, but will add cream cheese next time. I like a thicker sauce. I spices are great and the tortillas too.
Omg wayyy better than I imagined it would be, although Chef John has yet to let me down with his recipes! But where was my “pinch” of cayenne? Did I miss it? I’ll go back and look.
It’s definitely a family favorite but what I do is add Doritos to it for a little extra flavor :) definitely should try

A soupy mess. I would recommend skipping the chicken broth. As you notice in his video, he doesn't cut his open. I also suspect his tortillas are much thicker than the ones most of us buy in the grocery store. Flavor wasn't bad. But using two different kinds of special chili powders? Naw. Be sure to use a DEEP 9×13 pan. I might try this again, but I will make it simpler. Just mix chicken into the soupy mix & I won't quarter my tortillas as well as use more tortillas. I will also add more red bell pepper.
bussin
Substitute Hatch red and green peppers instead of bell peppers. I shredded bbq’d chicken. Prepare time longer than 30 minutes and i’m fast
ALWAYS a hit! I'm from Ft.Worth but now reside in NC. I take this to church functions and pot lucks. Had a Cuban friend request that I bring to a bbq last night. Everyone just raves!!!!

Fabulous! 100% better than an enchilada. I made three changes. 1)Added a 7 oz. can of green chilies in place of the green pepper. Used broken Tostito chips instead of tortillas, used only 1/4 cup broth. We all loved it. Thank you Chef John.
Yummy. I will add more tortillas (or chips) next time as 10 is not enough for us. Only change I made was more cheese and 2 jalepenos.

Overall, we liked this. It wasn’t “wow” but I’ll definitely keep it in rotation once in awhile. We like spicier food, and even with the addition of a fresh jalapeño and hot chili powder, it was mild at best. Not bad, but needs modifications according to your tastes

It is very good, so give it a five. Guests like it too. John begins the video with a passing remark about the King Ranch. I took my advanced flight training at NAS Kingsville surrounded by the King Ranch and learned a little history. Richard King acquired the land and established the ranch in 1853. He became a blockade-running sea captain in the Civil War and may be the model for Rhett Butler. He had no sons, only two daughters who married the Kleberg brothers, so the ranch has been owned and operated by Klebergs ever since. In hours flying over the ranch I saw cattle, an occasional horse, seldom any people, and even when going to the family compound on the ground didn't notice anything like a chicken house.
Love this recipe, but we Texans like a little heat! We use rotel tomatoes, green chili’s, and some good ol hatch chilli powder! Yum! Easy to put together if you have the chicken already cooked!

Spouse and I loved it. Cooked as directed, but it left a lot of cleanup as I also had to cook and cutup the chicken. Should have just let the chicken bake in oven while preheating. Not sure onions and peppers require pre-cooking as it just makes another pot to clean. Recipe made enough to freeze for another meal for two. Now its a staple at our house especially when kids are over. Thanks for sharing.

fantastic! I wasn't sure I could find the ancho powder and chipotle powder locally so I ordered online after I saw this recipe and decided I want to make it. Excellent flavor from those two spices! I totally botched the Assembly of this casserole because I was distracted. I started adding the chicken to the sauce but halfway into it realized I made a mistake. started trying to fish out the chicken from the sauce but gave up. Proceeded as directed. Still turned out awesome! I also forgot to add the sour cream but had a little on the side and it was nice! I would love to try this sometime with chorizo! I also want to say this would make an incredible Crock-Pot dip for a party just leave the tortillas out and use chips for dipping! Thank you Chef John and I wish you could tell me the proper proportions of the powders to make a taco seasoning!
Delicious. Will make again.

Family favorite. Serve with guacamole and sliced fresh tomatoes. I really prefer this recipe because it calls for spices that the most of them don’t. It Hass to have the flavor of chili powder cumin oregano and a little bit of ground coriander seed.
This was real good. I didn't add the chilli it was still good and creamy.
I made my own cream of mushroom and cream of chicken sauces to control for sodium. The dish was very moist and stood up well until the entire 9 x 3 pan was exhausted. Will definitely make again.

I had a bunch of chicken and thought this would be a good recipe to try it on. I only used white meat. Made according to recipe but I did cut by 1/2 the 2 types of chile and still found it just a bit to hot for our individual preference. Also thought there was too much liquid in the dish. Next time, will probably omit the chipotle chile and just use 1 tsp of Ancho chile. Also will omit the chicken broth and I think this will resolve the watery consistency. We did enjoy this. If you are not feeding an ARMY, maybe cut the receipe in half. Thanks for the submission. Although I'm not from Tx (sorry), We did enjoy this.
This was delicious! It is now on my revolving menu list.

I really enjoyed this casserole, it is creamy and very tasty. I was short on chicken so decided to add a can of black beans and I really loved the additional flavor and texture they provided. I also used about twice the amount of peppers to up the veggie content. I did use restaurant left over tortilla chips and they worked well, but they do seem to disappear in the end.

Great recipe, great flavor. Made a few changes. I didn’t have bell peppers so I used a can of fiesta corn that has red and green bell peppers in it. Delicious! I use a rotisserie chicken for this recipe. Also, I don’t use cheddar cheese, I use a Mexican blend or Monterey Jack cheese.
This was relatively easy, and a great blend of spices. We used “regular” rotel, and only cream of mushroom because that’s what we had on hand. It will definitely have a spot in our regular rotation!

Delicious! It tasted way better than I thought it would. I guess it goes to show that you probably shouldn't prejudge a recipe. I stuck to the basic recipe although I added a couple of Jalapeno pepper since I couldn't find a can of diced tomatoes that also had the chilis. And I used crumbled tortilla chips with lime flavoring instead of actual tortillas. I hope you like it as much as I do.
Best casserole. We use flour tortillas instead.

Great leftover recipe. It worked just fine with just Cream of Mushroom (didnt have Cream of Chicken). I also added corn. I would have sauteed the veges longer to make them softer. Was worried three layers of tortilla wouldnt be enough but it did not turn out soupy at all.

It went together easily. It needed more like an hour in the oven rather than 40 minutes. Tasty, but heavy; one serving will definitely do you. It was a good way to use up the chicken breasts I had thawed from the freezer. Next time I will make a point of shredding the chicken rather than just cutting it up into chunks.
I think the sauce turned out right for me
Not keeping chicken as tender as expected. Disappointing.
Very tasty but I would use mild rotel next time. It was a little spicy for us!

We loved this dish. The only thing I did slightly different was to use mild diced Tomatoes and chili. Next time I may try one of the other suggestions to use corn chips like Tostitos instead of corn tortillas. Also since I have difficulty swallowing I may add an additional can of soup. Great flavor.

Wow! This is the best chicken enchilada casserole dish ever!!! My only change was to use only regular chili powder as I didn’t have the ancho or the chipotle chili powder on hand. I’m glad too, because I think the heart may have been a bit much for my guests. They have trouble tolerating spicy food. The flavor was amazing!!! Definitely making this often.
VERY GOOD
While the flavour of the sauce is great, it was a big, soupy, sloppy mess, with soggy tortillas.

The flavors are spectacular! I also used rotisserie chicken to cut down on prep time. it was very soupy. Next time I will drain the rotel and possibly leave out the chicken broth. All easy fixes for something so good. I also saw that someone suggested letting the chicken sit in the sauce for 30 min, which I may try. Flavor-wise, it's a 5. consistency is a 3, but easily remedied.
It is so good. I added a can of corn and we loved it.

As usual, Chef John's recipes are delicious. I did have to make changes based on my family's preferences and what I had on hand. We have a mushroom hater so used 2 cans of cream of chicken and it worked just fine. I used some sweet onion and red onion, and a little red bell pepper because I had them cut up. Substituted 1 poblano pepper and 1 seeded jalapeno pepper instead of green pepper. I used the RoTel Hot tomatoes, and fiesta blend cheese instead of cheddar. I used regular chile powder for the ancho because i didn't have any. Then i used about 4 cups of pulled rotisserie chicken that I sprinkled with a home made (low salt) taco seasoning. Broiling at the end, as Chef John suggests, gave the top layer of tortillas and cheese a little crisp texture for contrast. Delicious, I am sure it would also be great as written and will probably be even better tomorrow.

This was labor intensive, and I did not love it. I have been eating very high fiber and low fat for almost two years. Then I made this when an employee’s relative passed away.,,not my usual style of eating in that it is high fat, high sodium, low fiber. Next time, I will just make chicken chili our chicken enchiladas instead.

Used one red and one yellow pepper instead of a green.
It was delicious! Will definitely make this again!
Not at all what I was expecting; it may have been a somewhat healthier version? Was lacking the creaminess (and flavor) I'm used to.
This is a very nice version of the standard recipe. I liked it much better than the one I've used for years. All the spices give it a great smokey flavor!

This is exactly the kind of comfort food I enjoy, and I had high hopes with the ingredients listed. I followed the recipe exactly, but the end product was soupy, far too spicy for a family meal (and I like some kick), and a little blah. I am a big fan of Chef John but this left me I’m disappointed.

Delicious for dinner and then for lunch. I actually adjusted the recipe for 4 since it was only myself and my husband. We wished we had made the original amount. The only adjustment I made was I added diced jalapeños. I was born and raised in New Orleans and we like a little kick. This was so so tasty. I can’t wait to make it for my grown kids. They will love it!!!!
Outstanding! Followed the recipe, just added sliced jalapeño and chopped cilantro for garnishment, because we like spice!

Made as directed, with ONE change (chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, instead of ancho and chipotle powder).
Husband said it’s like Chicken ala King tuned into a Mexican dish. It’s cheesy and creamy and rich. Very satisfying. (The canned peppers I used added an excellent spicy, smoky flavor!)

I normally don’t rate a recipe if i change anything but due to not having, and not willing to buy some of the spices i will do so anyway. I added a can of chili’s and did my best with the spices i had and it turned out great. The family loved it!
This is good!! We enjoyed immensely!!

I really liked the taste, however, not sure the purpose of the chicken broth as it made ours really soupy! I subbed a poblano ilo the green bell pepper but otherwise kept it the same. Would probably increase the chile pepper amounts next time as we like heat!

One of my family’s favorites! Instead of the cream of mushroom I used cream of celery because I’m allergic to mushrooms! I also use nacho cheese flavored Fritos instead of the corn tortillas! It turned out absolutely wonderful… Thank you for the recipe

Made this exactly as written, except my oven went out so I cooked it on the stove. I used a 4” deep cast iron pot with a cast iron lid. Preheated my cast iron. Layered as written, put the lid on for 10 minutes. Heat on low. Removed lid and simmered until the sauce thickened a lot. Heat still on low. Delicious.
I thought it was pretty tasty! I added a 1/2 a bag of tater tots before the first layer then fire roasted tomatoes with green chilis.(its what I had on hand) Yum
Way too soupy.
Really delicious. I've made other king ranch casserole recipes. This one is way better. I agree with leaving out the chicken broth. Otherwise it's too soupy. Will be making again for sure.

made a few changes. I used Dark Chili pwdr and Hot mexican chili pwdr. I used tortilla chips and waaaaaaay more cheese than it calls for. Buy at least 16 ozs. I also accidentally mixed the chicken into the sauce but this actually worked out just fine. Delicious and easy! Freezes well.
I doubled this recipe. Used Tostitos original chips rather than tortillas and they worked perfectly. Baked it for 75 minutes in a 10 X 15 pan. Everyone loved it!
So yummy with a nice kick!
Substituted all spices for a ranch packet
I have made this several times now. My family lives it!
Tastes like chicken enchiladas in casserole form. My friends and I loved the recipe. I fully plan to make it again in the future.
very good

This is a quick and easy recipe. Great for a small gathering. I use a few pounds of chicken thighs rather than a whole chicken - - the meat is more tender. I also use Mexican cheese blend rather than the cheddar. And, like a lot of casserole dishes, this tastes even better after a night in the fridge. I always tell friends this is a secret family recipe - only shared with all of Texas !

Tasty, with enough heat to keep me happy and not so much that it scares away the rest of my family. I made the variation a commentor mentioned with Doritos in place of the tortillas, and it was fab! Our pickiest eater asked for more. Thanks so much for this!

One of my favorites... Did not have exact spices and ingredients, so I changed a few things - no oregano or mushroom soup (doubled cream of chicken), used flour tortillas instead of corn, and added jalapeños to half of it. Love it so much, I doubled recipe and froze a second batch!
Delicious! Everyone loved it
